title: Brown v. Board of Education National Historic Site: Things To Do
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Things To Do             Things To Do            Indoor Activities Whether you have 30 minutes or several hours at the site, learn more about the history of segregation in America, the Brown v. Board of Education decision, and the legacy of the case around the world. Independently tour our galleries, explore a temporary exhibit, or go on a historic Monroe School building tour. These free 15-25 minute ranger-led tours depart at 10am and 2pm, or on request when staffing permits. For more information about the exhibits, click here.             Schedule of Events Search the calendar before visiting to see if there are any special activities or site closures by clicking here. The site is closed on federal holidays except Martin Luther King, Jr. Day.           Nearby Attractions Coming to Brown v. Board of Education NHS and want to visit some other local sites of interest? Click here for more information about Topeka, other sites in Kansas, and the other four national parks in the state.           Special Events Brown v. Board of Education NHS is always planning new and exciting special events for our visitors. Click here for detailed information about these events.           Outdoor Activities Enjoy lunch at the picnic tables. Bring a kite or a frisbee and play on the historic playground. Go for a walk on the Landon Trail. Take some time and enjoy the outdoors! Click here to see pictures of amenities available.
